title: Riot has access to a lot of data. Why is the Matchmaking so horrible?
body: I need real answers from real Riot employees. Enough of the cover ups, broken promises, and openly worded Summoner's Code. Tell players the truth. We'll respect you more.

replies.body:
Because even with that data, there is no way to compensate for:

* Individual champion skill of a player - especially since picks happen after matchmaking.

* Fred having 3 beers before playing

* Counterpicks and matchups in general

Also, queue times are long enough already, the tighter they make matchmaking, the longer they get - especially for higher rank player.

New players also take a while to stabilize ELO/MMR, until they they drift aimlessly.

I agree with your position, however these are reason I feel that Riot is lying about their matchmaking system's effectiveness. They openly state that they will try to match you will players of your same skill level. At lower tiers, where the mix is of old and new players, what proof are they providing us to ensure these matches are balanced? You can't see MMR nor past games in champ select. You can't see their preferred roles in champ select. You can't see their most played champion in champ select. You don't even have time to discuss comp or strategy with said comp before the game. It's a game of luck, which it shouldn't be.
Computers aren't miracle workers.

Not only are they expected to "carry," but carrying is now harder.
